Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social and governance (ESG) factors in credit analysis

Absolute gross financed emissions, disaggregated by Scope 1, Scope 2 and Scope 3 for each industry by asset class. Measured in accordance with paragraph 29(a) and B62 of IFRS S2 Climate-related Disclosures.

provenance.section_title: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Credit Analysis

entities.label: Gross Exposure by Industry and Asset Class

properties.description: Gross exposure for each industry by asset class, expressed in the presentation currency of the entity's financial statements. Prepared in accordance with paragraph B62 of IFRS S2 Climate-related Disclosures.

provenance.section_title: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Credit Analysis

entities.label: Percentage of Gross Exposure in Financed Emissions

properties.description: Percentage of gross exposure included in the financed emissions calculation. If less than 100%, entity shall disclose information explaining exclusions, including the type of assets excluded.
Description of the methodology used to calculate financed emissions, including the method of allocation used to attribute share of emissions in relation to the size of gross exposure.

Total amount of monetary losses as a result of legal proceedings associated with fraud, insider trading, antitrust, anti-competitive behaviour, market manipulation, malpractice, or other related financial industry laws or regulations.

Description of whistleblower policies and procedures including internal compliance programmes, hotline details, publication of hotline number, incentives for reporting violations, methods for submitting tips, applicable jurisdictional laws, and any violations with corrective actions
Global Systemically Important Bank (G-SIB) overall score calculated from (1) size, (2) cross-jurisdictional activity, (3) interconnectedness, (4) substitutability, and (5) complexity categories

entities.label: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Credit Analysis

properties.section_title: Incorporation of Environmental, Social, and Governance Factors in Credit Analysis

properties.description: Description of approach to incorporation of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors in credit analysis, including: parties responsible, roles and responsibilities, ESG research approach, creditworthiness assessment approach, oversight and accountability, scenario analysis at portfolio level, ESG trends consideration, credit exposure concentrations, and influence on traditional macro/microeconomic factors and creditworthiness.
